name: Sofia Kovalevskaya
quote: It is impossible to be a mathematician without being a poet in soul.
summary: Russian mathematician who was the first woman to earn a PhD in mathematics and the first woman to become a professor of mathematics.
shortDescription: Sofia Kovalevskaya was a Russian mathematician who was the first woman to earn a PhD in mathematics and the first woman to become a professor of mathematics. Her work in partial differential equations and mechanics was groundbreaking.

detailed_description.early_life: Born in Moscow, Sofia showed exceptional talent in mathematics from an early age. She was educated privately and later studied at universities in Germany.
detailed_description.stem_journey: Sofia earned her PhD from the University of Göttingen and became a professor at Stockholm University. She made significant contributions to partial differential equations and mechanics.
detailed_description.challenges: As a woman in 19th-century Russia and Europe, Sofia faced significant barriers to education and career advancement in mathematics.
detailed_description.achievements: First woman to earn a PhD in mathematics, first woman to become a professor of mathematics, and made groundbreaking contributions to mathematical analysis.
detailed_description.legacy: Sofia's achievements opened doors for women in mathematics and inspired future generations of female mathematicians.
